result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory C Boyde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory C Boyde

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Sent to Defendant (1)JOC (2)Standing Order re: Criminal Costs/Fees//sent to LKA
with elements and criminal case settlement

Case called at 2:07pm [mo]
Defendant Gregory C Boyde in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance; submits Victim Impact Statement

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety; no presence in bars or taverns
--complete a certified batterers' intervention program
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay subpoena fees in the amount of $154
--No Contact with Michelle Plansky unless she agrees in advance and the Agent approves in advance


Days credit for time already served:  1  days
The Court directs that if the Cash Bail remains on file, it is to be applied to Mr. Boyde's court costs, and then the remainder, if any, to be returned to the postee. 
recess: 2:32pm

Case called at 8:17am [mo]
Defendant Gregory C Boyde in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

On the Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification:
--ADA Shock verifies receipt of Motion
--ADA Shock gives arguments opposing Motion
--Atty. Huebner gives arguments in support of Motion, notes that the victim is present in the gallery
--Atty. Huebner questions Ms. Plansky as to her position on bond modification
--The Court reviews Court Record, including Criminal Complaint
The Court denies the Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification.
recess: 8:27am
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond

Case called at 8:38am [mo]
Defendant Gregory C Boyde in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.

Atty. Huebner requests that a FSSC and Jury Trial be scheduled.
Atty. Huebner indicates that the victim of this case is present in the courtroom gallery and wishes to have the no contact condition of bond removed. 
ADA Shock objects on the lack of notification.
The Court directs the Clerk to schedule a motion hearing. 
recess: 8:45am 

NEXT: 1)Motion Hearing (Bond Modification) on 9/17/15 at 8:15am  2)FSSC on 11/16/15 at 2:00pm  3)Jury Trial on 11/19/15 at 8:30am

Case called at 11:13 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Gregory C Boyde in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; charge/penalties recited; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court continues $500 cash bond, already posted, with conditions: 
-Absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or package houses
-No acts or threats of violence
-No contact with Michelle Plansky
Recess: 11:19 am

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 8/12/15 at 11:20 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 9/8/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
